cab.content: From Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of State for India,10th May 1919.Clear the line.6385. North-West Frontier. Continuation of our telegram of 7th instant, No. 6241. On 9th May following were general dispositions : (a) 1st Division between Kacha Garhi and Landi Kotal. (6) 2nd Division moving into Peshawar area.On morning of 9th May our advanced forces at Landi expelled Afghans from positions in the vicinity of that locality. Aeroplanes co-operated and bombed Loi Dakka with good results. Enemy are still in position to the west about kharre Gali. Our casualties were slight.You should see Chief of General Staffs Intelligence Reports to Director of Military Intelligence.Note. Kacha Garhi, about seven miles west of Peshawar. Loi Dakka, in Afghanistan on the Kabul River about 10 miles North-West of Landi Kotal. kharre Gali, about 2-j miles west of Landi Kotal.
